sage.scene.bounding

Class BoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.bounding.BoundingVolume
      • sage.scene.bounding.BoundingBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BoundingBox
extends BoundingVolume
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class defines a BoundingVolume which is an axis-aligned bounding box (AABB). An AABB has a location, the position of the center of the box, and a set of extents in each of X, Y, and Z. Note that the extent of an AABB defines the distance from the center to one edge of the box, not the total size in a given direction.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class sage.scene.bounding.BoundingVolume

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox()
      Constructs a BoundingBox with a default center of (0,0,0) and default extents of 1.0 in each of X, Y, and Z (in other words, a 2x2x2 cube centered at the origin).
      BoundingBox(graphicslib3D.Point3D center, float xExtent, float yExtent, float zExtent)
      Constructs a BoundingBox with the specified center and extents.

        Constructs a BoundingBox with the specified center and extents.
        Parameters:
        center - The center point (location) of the sphere
        xExtent - The distance in the X direction to one side of the box
        yExtent - The distance in the Y direction to one side of the box
        zExtent - The distance in the Z direction to one side of the box

      • contains

        public boolean contains(graphicslib3D.Point3D p)
        Returns true if this BoundingBox contains the specified point; otherwise returns false. Points lying on the surface of the box are considered to be contained by the box.
        Specified by:
        contains in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        p - the point about which containment by the box is being queried
        Returns:
        true if this BoundingBox contains p; false otherwise

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(BoundingVolume otherBV)
        Returns true if the specified BoundingVolume intersects this BoundingBox. Note: touching is considered intersecting.

        Warning: currently this method is only capable of comparing this BoundingBox with another BoundingBox; passing any other type of BoundingVolume to this method causes it to throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        intersects in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        otherBV - - the BoundingVolume to check for intersection with this BoundingVolume
        Returns:
        true if this BV intersects the specified BV

      • transformBy

        public BoundingVolume transformBy(graphicslib3D.Matrix3D mat,
                                  double[] scaleValues)
        Applies the specified transformation to the center point (location) of this BoundingBox. Scales the x, y, and z extents of the BoundingBox using the values stored in the scaleValues parameter.
        Specified by:
        transformBy in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        mat - The transformation matrix to be applied to this box's center
        scaleValues - - an array of doubles holding the x, y, and z scale values of the matrix transforming this bounding volume.
        Returns:
        this, transformed

      • isOnNegativeSide

        public boolean isOnNegativeSide(Plane pl)
        Returns true if this BoundingBox lies completely on the negative side of the specified Plane; returns false if any portion of this BoundingBox touches or lies on the positive side of the specified Plane.

        Note that this method assumes that the center of this BoundingBox, the extents of this BoundingBox, and the coefficients of the specified Plane are all in world coordinates; it is the responsibility of the invoking application to insure this condition.

        Specified by:
        isOnNegativeSide in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        pl - - the Plane against which to test this BoundingVolume
        Returns:
        true if this BV lies entirely on the negative side of the plane

      • merge

        public BoundingVolume merge(BoundingVolume otherBV)
        Returns a BoundingVolume which surrounds both this BoundingBox and the specified BoundingVolume. If the specified BoundingVolume is a BoundingBox then a new BoundingBox containing both this BoundingBox and the specified BoundingBox is returned. If the specified BoundingVolume is null then this BoundingBox is returned. If the specified BoundingVolume is not a BoundingBox then an exception is thrown; the current implementation does not support merging a BoundingBox with any BoundingVolume type other than another BoundingBox.

        Note that this method assumes that the center and extent values for both this BoundingBox and the specified other BoundingVolume are in world coordinates.

        Specified by:
        merge in class BoundingVolume
        Parameters:
        otherBV - - the BoundingVolume which is to be merged with this BoundingBox
        Returns:
        a BoundingBox which contains this BoundingBox and the specified BoundingVolume
